doc: ['Typhoid fever in child aged less than 5 year .', 'Background .', 'Calculation of the incidence of typhoid fever during preschool year is important to define the optimum age of immunisation and the choice of vaccine for public-health programme in developing country .', 'Hospital-based study have suggested that child younger than 5 year do not need vaccination against typhoid fever , but this view needs to be re-examined in community-based longitudinal study .', 'We undertook a prospective follow-up study of resident of a low-income urban area of Delhi , India , with active surveillance for case detection .', 'Method .', 'A baseline census was undertaken in 1995 .', 'Between Nov 1 , 1995 , and Oct 31 , 1996 , we visited 8172 resident of 1820 household in Kalkaji , Delhi , twice weekly to detect febrile case .', 'Blood sample were obtained from febrile patient , and those who tested positive for Salmonella typhi were treated with ciprofloxacin .', 'Finding .', '63 culture-positive typhoid fever case were detected .', 'Of these , 28 ( 44 % ) were in child aged under 5 year .', 'The incidence rate of typhoid per 1000 person-years was 27.3 at age under 5 year , 11.7 at 5-19 year , and 1.1 between 19 and 40 year .', 'The difference in the incidence of typhoid fever between those under 5 year and those aged 5-19 year ( 15.6 per 1000 person-years [ 95 % CI 4.7-26.5 ] ) , and those aged 19-40 year ( 26.2 [ 16.0-36.3 ] ) was significant ( p < 0.001 far both ) .', 'The difference between the incidence of typhoid at 5-19 year and the incidence at 19-40 year was also significant ( 10.6 [ 6.3-14.8 ] , p < 0 001 ) .', 'Morbidity in those under 5 and in older people was similar in term of duration of fever , sign and symptom , and need for hospital admission .', 'Interpretation .', 'Our finding challenge the common view that typhoid fever is a disorder of school-age child and of adult .', 'Typhoid is a common and significant cause of morbidity between 1 and 5 year of age .', 'The optimum age of typhoid immunisation and the choice of vaccine need to be reassessed.This study was conducted to measure the incidence of typhoid fever among preschooler .', 'It was suggested that child aged 5 year do not need vaccination against typhoid fever .', 'However , it is important to re-examine this view , particularly in infant and young child in the low-income urban area of Delhi , India , through active surveillance .', 'Blood sample were obtained from febrile patient , and those who tested positive for Salmonella typhi were treated with ciprofloxacin .', 'Finding revealed 63 culture-positive typhoid fever case , about 44 % of which were in child under 5 year of age .', 'Morbidity in child under age 5 and in older people was similar in term of duration of fever , sign and symptom , and the need for hospital admission .', 'The incidence of typhoid fever and the age distribution of the case varied between developing country .', 'Thus , the age pattern of typhoid fever observed in the urban study area may differ in rural area within India or in other developing country .', 'A reevaluation of the optimum age and vaccine of choice is needed .', 'Revanchist sanitisation or coercive care ?', 'The use of enforcement to combat begging , street drinking and rough sleeping in England .', "This paper examines recent response to 'problematic street culture ' in England , where increasing pressure has been exerted to prevent people from begging and street drinking in public space , with rough sleeping also targeted in some area .", "Drawing upon in-depth interview with enforcement agent , support provider and targeted individual , it assesses the extent to which the strategy employed are indicative of a 'revanchist expulsion ' of the deviant Other and/or an expression of 'coercive care ' for the vulnerable Other .", 'It concludes that , whilst the recent development appear , at first glance , to be symptomatic of revanchist sanitisation of public space , closer examination reveals that the situation is actually much more complex than a revanchist reading of the situation might suggest , and perhaps not as devoid of compassion .', 'Defining Suburbs .', 'There is no consensus as to what exactly constitutes a suburb .', 'This article examines the range of suburban definition in term of their structure and the topical issue that they grapple with .', 'Suburb have been defined according to many different dimension from location and transportation mode to culture and physical appearance .', 'Given this confusion , one approach is to abandon the term ; another is to use it with greater precision .', 'This is more than just an issue of semantics .', 'Rather how people talk and think about suburb shape how they can see such area being developed and redeveloped in the future .', 'Ethnic minority group and the design of public open scape : An inclusive landscape ?', '.', 'People from ethnic minority group have a range of experience of living in Britain , some of which are significantly different from those of white British people .', 'Previous research and case study suggest that the physical environment has a positive or negative role in perception of everyday life .', 'It is argued that landscape have a symbolic dimension , and aspect of landscape can be recognized as familiar or alien , welcoming or excluding .', 'A wide variety of case study in Britain are used to discuss design and management practice that reflect a range of cultural experience .', 'The need for landscape architect and manager to be aware of how place may be interpreted in different way by different ethnic minority group , and to work towards inclusive design , is highlighted .', 'From multiculturalism to multinaturalism : What rule of method for the new socio-scientific experiment ?', '.', 'This article reflects on the traditional distinction between scientific laboratory experimenting on theory and phenomenon and a political outside where non-experts make do with human value , opinion , and passion .', 'Since today all people are engaged in emerging collective experiment on matter as varied as climate , food , landscape , health , urban design , and technical communication as consumer , militant , and citizen , they can all be considered co-researchers .', "Co-researching has consequence for our understanding of nature and demands a renewed attention to `` multinaturalist '' politics .", 'It also question the division of labor between expert and nonexperts .', "The article finishes with a call to `` dis-invent '' modernity so that we `` modern '' can finally become ordinary human again .", 'Greater Portland : Urban life and landscape in the Pacific Northwest .', 'It has been called one of the nation ’ s most livable region , ranked among the best managed city in America , hailed as a top spot to work , and favored as a great place to do business , enjoy the art , pursue outdoor recreation , and make one ’ s home .', 'Indeed , year of cooperative urban planning between developer and those interested in ecology and habitability have transformed Portland from a provincial western city into an exemplary American metropolis .', 'Its thriving downtown , its strong neighborhood , and its pioneering effort at local management have brought a steady procession of journalist , scholar , and civic leader to investigate the “ Portland style ” that values dialogue and consensus , treats politics as a civic duty , and assumes that it is possible to work toward public good .', 'Probing behind the press clipping , acclaimed urban historian Carl Abbott examines the character of contemporary Portland-its people , politics , and public life-and the region ’ s history and geography in order to discover how Portland has achieved its reputation as one of the most progressive and livable city in the United States and to determine whether typical pressure of urban growth are pushing Portland back toward the national norm .', 'In Greater Portland , Abbott argues that the city can not be understood without reference to its place .', 'Its river , hill , and broader regional setting have shaped the economy and the cityscape .', 'Portlanders are Oregonians , Northwesteners , Cascadians ; they value their city as much for where it is as for what it is , and this powerful sense of place nurtures a distinctive civic culture .', 'Tracing the way in which Portlanders have talked and thought about their city , Abbott reveals the tension between their diverse vision of the future and plan for development .', 'Most citizen of Portland desire a balance between continuity and change , one that supports urban progress but actively monitors its effect on the region ’ s expansive green space and on the community ’ s culture .', 'This strong civic participation in city planning and politics is what gives greater Portland its unique character , a positive setting for class integration , neighborhood revitalization , and civic value .', 'The result , Abbott confirms , is a region whose unique initiative remain a model of American urban planning .', 'Natural disaster and nuclear crisis in Japan : Response and recovery after Japan ’ s 3/11 .', 'The March 2011 earthquake and tsunami in Japan plunged the country into a state of crisis .', 'As the nation struggled to recover from a record breaking magnitude 9 earthquake and a tsunami that was as high as thirty-eight meter in some place , news trickled out that Fukushima had experienced meltdown in three reactor .', 'These tragic catastrophe claimed some 20,000 life , initially displacing some 500,000 people and overwhelming Japan ’ s formidable disaster preparedness.This book brings together the analysis and insight of a group of distinguished expert on Japan to examine what happened , how various institution and actor responded and what lesson can be drawn from Japan ’ s disaster .', 'The contributor , many of whom experienced the disaster first hand , assess the wide–ranging repercussion of this catastrophe and how it is already reshaping Japanese culture , politics , energy policy , and urban planning .', 'Brain culture : Shaping policy through neuroscience .', 'This unique book offers a timely analysis of the impact of rapidly advancing knowledge about the brain , mind and behaviour on contemporary public policy and practice .', 'Examining development in behaviour change policy , neuroscience , architecture and urban design , education , and workplace training programmes the book analyses the global spread of research agenda , policy experiment and everyday practice informed by ‘ brain culture ’ .It offers an alternative , geographically informed set of explanation for what matter in explaining how people behave and how citizen ’ behaviour should be governed .', 'It will be of interest to student and academic across the social and behavioural science .', 'The middle class in neoliberal China : Governing risk , life-building , and themed space .', "Since the late 1970s , China 's move towards neoliberalism has made it not only one of the world 's fastest growing economy , but also one of the most polarised state .", 'This economic , social and political transformation has led to the emergence of a new Chinese middle class , and understanding the development and the role of this new social group is crucial to understanding contemporary Chinese society .', 'Investigating the new politics of the middle class in China , this book addresses three major question .', 'First , how does the Chinese state deal with problem of national sovereignty and political representation to create the middle class both as a legitimate category of the people and as an ideal norm of citizenship ?', 'Second , how does the recognition of the middle class norm take place in the practice of everyday life ?', 'Finally , what kind of risk does the politics of the middle class generate not only for middle class subject but also for the disenfranchised ?', 'In answering these question , this book examines a set of practice , body of knowledge , measure , and institution that aim to manage , govern , control , and orient the behaviour , gesture , and thought of Chinese citizen .', 'This investigation contributes not only to the understanding of the Chinese middle class society but also to the scholarly debate over the relationship between governmental apparatus , subjectification , and life-building .', 'Drawing on ethnographic information , historical archive , and the medium , this book will be of great interest to student and scholar working in the field of Chinese study , Chinese politics , ethnic study and urban study , as well as those interested in culture , society , class and welfare .', "Imagining Portland 's urban growth boundary : Planning regulation as cultural icon .", "Problem : In the 30 year since its creation , has Portland , Oregon 's , urban growth boundary ( UGB ) become something more than a regulation ?", 'Spirited debate about its impact on land us and value has inspired vivid description by both supporter and critic and spurred the imagination of artist and creative writer .', 'Purpose : The UGB has become a symbol , metaphor , and touchstone , as people read complex meaning into it that go beyond its simple legal function .', 'This article looks at the UGB as a cultural icon .', 'It explores the increasingly complex way in which people have tried to describe , understand , and interpret the UGB as part of the regional landscape as well as the regulatory system .', 'It examines metaphorical description of the UGB as well as the growing body of depiction in nature writing , poetry , novel , photography , performance art , song , and other exercise of the artistic imagination .', 'Method : We review how supporter and critic of the UGB have described it and how artist have depicted it in various media.results and conclusion : Although many planning project have become icon , few planning regulation have done so .', 'Artistic interpretation have familiarized and humanized the UGB and embedded it in the consciousness of everyday life .', 'Artist thus make the invisible more visible or legible .', 'Acting as a viewfinder , the UGB offers an opportunity for conversation and interpretation from multiple perspective .', 'Takeaway for practice : In the world of 21st-century planning theory there is a strong assumption that many voice engaged in overlapping conversation can help shape more equitable and sustainable city .', "Creative depiction of Portland 's UGB show the role of cultural actor in shaping and enriching such conversation .", 'Toronto and Vancouver bound : The location choice of new Canadian immigrant .', 'Ethnic clustering plays an important role in the location choice of new immigrant to Canada .', 'A concentration of people in the same geographic area who are of similar ethnic background , culture and language can be an important source of financial and personal support , information and guidance , and social more .', 'Evidence is found that , after controlling for a range of other observable and unobservable factor important to the location decision , the concentration of people of a particular ethnic group in a particular area has a significant effect on the chance that new immigrant of the same ethnic group will choose to live there .', 'The size of the effect , however , depends on the personal characteristic of immigrant .', 'The attraction of ethnic concentration of immigrant is significantly smaller for new immigrant with a university degree and for those who normally speak English at home .', 'Characteristic of the local ethnic community related to education and language profile are also significant determinant of location choice .', 'Scale , regime , and the urban governance of Glasgow .', 'Over the last two decade , urban regime theory has become one of the most dominant paradigms of thought in urban study .', 'In particular , regime theory offers a complex account of urban governance , or how local government , the business community , and community organization gain the capacity to shape the policy that affect city , that is , govern .', 'Although regime theory is a dominant theory in urban study , it does , nevertheless , have its share of detractor , and one criticism has been its failure to take into account geographical scale .', 'While there is an acknowledgment in urban regime theory of wider economic process , such as the broad transformation in international and national trade , investment , finance , etc.', ', or the role played by federal or state government , the bias has remained mostly local , particularly in regard to urban governance .', 'In urban regime theory literature the policy and action of international and national institution either nicely conjoin with local interest or are nearly totally absent .', 'Due to this oversight , urban regime theory tends to underemphasize how the capacity to govern a city effectively is sometimes the result of the interaction of action of people at multiple scale .', 'This article attempts to address this oversight in an analysis of Glasgow , Scotland , during the 1980s .', 'By focusing on the role of the European City of Culture in the revitalization of the city , this article demonstrates how the capacity for a ruling coalition to transform the city and to govern effectively was the consequence of the policy and administrative action undertaken at other geographical scale .', "Lewis Mumford 's Urbanism and the Problem of Environmental Modernity .", 'This essay reconsiders the early career of Lewis Mumford and the assumption that modernity has been disastrous environmentally .', 'Might it be possible to see Mumford , especially in his writing of the 1930s , as an early exemplar of green urbanism ?', 'Within environmental history , Mumford has been treated mostly as a regionalist - sometimes even as an opponent of the city .', "This essay argues that in fact his path toward ecological `` balance '' led directly through the city , not out of it .", "Indeed , he gives us access to modernity 's ambivalence and complexity by accompanying his trenchant critique of modern city with a positive vision for how people might design and occupy urban space more sustainably .", "To rediscover Mumford is to reconsider the city not just as a site of erasure and hubristic `` renewal '' but also as a landscape full of what he called `` remnant '' and `` persistents '' ; it is to rediscover modernity 's environmental possibility , in line with current trend in urban ecology and design , and with the new momentum in urban environmental history to combine material and cultural perspective .", 'Whither aboriginal education ?', '.', 'Taiwanese government is continuously putting significant effort into aboriginal education that is vital to keep their traditional culture alive and offers a way to success and self-realization .', 'Adding point to school admission examination score and government funding for overseas student are benefiting aboriginal student .', 'The government , in addition to the preservation of aboriginal language , has worked out a system for writing the language , completed the compilation of the teaching material for the nine-year compulsory education system and passed the relevant law to encourage indigenous student .', 'The College of Indigenous Studies at National Dong Hwa University is expected to become a foundation for talent cultivation and offer job opportunity to indigenous people .', 'Some tribal college have also been set up to combine ethnic , educational , cultural and community resource to develop tribal wisdom and shape a collective will in tribe .', 'The Formation of the Urban Environment in the West Siberian Oil and Gas Region : Problems and Challenges .', 'The article deal with the problem faced by the person in relation to the culture of creating a sustainable urban environment .', 'The urban environment is seen as space of human existence , influencing its spiritual and physical health .', 'All the expert involved in the urban environment , think about the culture of its formation , unfortunately , only from a departmental point of view .', 'Differently organized human environment inevitably affects behavior , emotional state of a man , his perception and understanding of space .', 'The cultural heritage of society fit in the space of an artificial environment created by a man , and determines the behavior of people.For the solution of problem of formation of the urban environment , it is necessary to apply a set of interrelated technical , social , environmental , aesthetic and other measure .', 'In this capacity , landscape design as a set of method has to build a sustainable urban environment to ensure harmonious living.Current trend , method , and technique of landscape design are to create sustainable environment for a person - creative , spiritual , comfortable , attractive , safe , harmonious .', 'Promptness and sustainability in town reconstruction following the 2011 great east Japan earthquake .', 'Local government in Iwate Prefecture also drew respective plan for reconstruction to rebuild their city , financially backed up by the prefectural and national government coupled with special law and measure .', 'They are planning central city area under the principle of DRR as well as BBB .', 'There are too many law pertaining to disaster prevention and reconstruction to refer to in full here .', 'Therefore , this chapter focuses only on some of the new enactment after the GEJE .', 'But attention has to be paid to their approach to reconstruction when it comes to the question of whether they sufficiently concord with DRR and BBB ( Ikuta 2013 ; Kaneko 2014 ) .', 'The Basic Act on Reconstruction in Response to the GEJE 2011 ( hereinafter the Basic Act 2011 ) prescribes that , considering the unprecedented national crisis caused by the GEJE , the act has the purpose of promoting the smooth and prompt reconstruction and revitalization of a vibrant Japan , securing financial resource , identifying afflicted area as Special Zone for Reconstruction with institutional and tax measure and establishing a Reconstruction Agency to undertake task regarding integrated national measure ( Art .', '1 ) .', 'The Basic Act 2011 then prescribes its basic philosophy , adopting the idea of the building back better concept , promoting dramatic measure for revitalization that are not limited to physical recovery of afflicted facility , but also reconstruction measure to assist individual to overcome the disaster and lead prosperous life while honoring local culture and enhancing people ’ s tie with the community ( Art .', '2 ) .', 'The Act for Special Zones for Reconstruction 2011 was enacted as separate legislation from the Basic Act 2011 to implement the reconstruction measure .', 'Under this legislation , afflicted local government designated as special area can acquire significantly larger budget fund from the national government for recovery and can deregulate their spatial planning under the Agricultural Land Act , the Forest Act and the Urban Planning Act .', 'Via this funding and deregulation , they can plan recovery-related project for disaster prevention : the promotion of collective relocation , functional reinforcement of fishery village , land reallocation for the revival of affected city area , basic construction to lead city center towards recovery from the tsunami and disaster-resistant public housing .', 'The Act on Town Planning for Tsunami Disaster Prevention 2011 allows prefectural government to set tsunami hazard zone and municipal government to make integrated town plan for tsunami disaster prevention .', 'Under the act , prefectural government can set the presumed tsunami hazard zone and special tsunami warning zone .', 'In the latter zone , normal town planning and building activity are restricted .', 'Using of indigenous knowledge in agriculture .', 'Experience shows that indigenous knowledge not only has no contradiction with formal knowledge but different indigenous knowledge feature , put it as well complementary for formal knowledge .', 'Indigenous knowledge is accessible , useful and cheap .', 'Its perspective is holistic and its transmission is verbal .', 'Knowledge is dynamic and time-tested , and while it has grown within local natural and social environment , so it is very sustainable with indigenous condition .', 'Indigenous knowledge refers to both component and whole part of culture of each nation and this component and whole integration is so that stop to change traditional society of life without indigenous knowledge out of its cultural origin and therefore would lose it concept and effectiveness .', 'in recent decade following issue had been recognized very essential : programming and performing development plan , indigenous knowledge at farming , pest control , ranching , veterinary , nutrition , medicine , watershed management , foresting , architecture , urban planning , social association and decision making method as sustainable technology .', 'At on hand , reason of this great evolution can be found due to wrong policy and at the other hand in undesirable environmental consequence of these policy .', 'Indigenous knowledge is different with scientific knowledge that was established by university and scientific community .', 'This knowledge is basis for decision making at field of agriculture , health , education , food and natural source Indigenous knowledge is set of all knowledge and skill that people enjoy in one geographical area ( in one environmental condition ) that most of their skill and knowledge be transmitted to next generation , and new generation would be adapted with them and add to it Since , each knowledge is consequent of individual interaction with environment , so indigenous knowledge is consequent of indigenous people interaction with their environment .']

['Moving young life : Mobility , immobility and inter-generational tension in urban Africa .', "This paper explores young people 's experience and perception of mobility and mobility constraint in poorer urban area of Ghana , Malawi and South Africa within the specific context of inter-generational relation .", "Drawing principally on qualitative research finding from a study involving both adult and child researcher , our aim is to chart the diversity and commonality of urban young people 's mobility experience in the everyday - how they use and experience the city - developing a comparative perspective across three urban study site which links young people 's mobility with the power relation that operate to shape their movement in individual location .", "In particular , we consider how positive and negative image of young people 's mobility play out in term of the inter-generational friction and negotiation generated by their mobility performance .", "We also reflect on the developmental implication , in term of young people 's access to service and income and their participation in the social network and peer culture which may shape their life trajectory .", 'Three theme are explored in detail : mobility as challenge , mobility as temptation and mobility control .', 'Intellectual of empire : Eric Dutton and hegemony in British Africa .', 'This essay examines the career of Eric Dutton in five British African colony from 1919 to 1952 , with case study of his work in Lusaka and Zanzibar .', "In analyzing Dutton 's career , I use a Gramscian conception of the role of intellectual in creating colonial hegemony , against the backdrop of recent research on the relationship of geography to colonial discourse .", "Dutton worked and corresponded with key player in Britain 's African empire .", 'He was a major force behind early urban-planning program in East and Central Africa and author of four geographical book .', 'Permanently disabled by war wound , he was also permanently infatuated with the moral rightness of British imperial culture .', "A concern for geography 's professional relationship with , and the geographical legacy of , colonialism has emerged in recent scholarship on Africa , largely through study of travel writing , fiction , and nineteenth- or early twentieth-century exploration geography .", "Later scholar-officials like Dutton sought to apply their knowledge to the shaping of space to serve the Empire 's direct and immediate need in Africa , even while trying to win the heart and mind of its subject people .", "Around Timothy Mitchell 's ( 1988 ) concept of `` enframing , '' I build an analysis of the spatial project with which Dutton is most associated and show how Lusaka and Zanzibar were enframed by his plan .", 'Through his publication and correspondence , as well as his seemingly omnipresent service , Dutton has an important legacy that has neither been articulated nor analyzed , one which points to the importance of contextualized biography for analysis of colonial discourse .', 'I argue here for seeing Dutton as an intellectual in the service of colonial hegemony and its enframing spatial discourse , although the character of his agency exemplifies why that attempted hegemony failed .', 'What is the urban without physical mobility ?', 'COVID-19-induced immobility in the mobile risk society .', 'Since the World Health Organization ’ s ( WHO ) declared the Coronavirus outbreak a global pandemic , the virus has invaded life around the globe .', 'The ongoing health , social and economic crisis that followed forced urban life , business , culture , community etc .', 'into idle mode for week resulting from mandated immobility .', 'What was once taken for granted as the essence of urban experience such as cultural activity , meeting friend , relative and colleague in public space or in professional encounter , disappeared overnight .', 'Free movement became significantly restricted all over the world .', 'It seemed that immobility , social and physical distancing , and isolation were the only antidote to the fast-moving virus .', 'For many people , working from home while also schooling their child and providing social care at a distance , peak activity at maximum physical immobility became the “ new normal.', '” A culture emerged where rule and norm of mobility previously taken for granted were re-negotiated and re-defined .', 'Before the crisis and despite the negative ecological side effect , mobility has been positively connotated as a signifier for progress and success .', 'Under the Corona regime mobility turned into a life-threatening risk .', 'The theory of reflexive modernization , risk society and the mobility paradigm are used to discuss these contemporary shift and transformation .', 'Continuity in tradition : A narrative on the cultural heritage of para and adda in Kolkata .', "'Para ' and 'adda ' are two unique example of intangible cultural resource of the Indian state of Bengal and Bangladesh .", 'Para signifies a community or neighbourhood that share close spatial proximity and similar emotional ideology , whereas adda denotes an exchange of casual or intellectual discussion among people .', 'Para refers to a spatial connotation with a neighbourhood , but the physical manifestation is not the only pre-requisite to form a para .', "Para reflects a networked social cohesion as the continuous affection concretely demonstrated in people 's decision about where to live , how to work and with whom to engage in their daily life .", 'Culture , ethnicity , language , food habit , mutual feeling of belongingness and robust social networking within a neighbourhood contribute to the growth of a para .', 'Adda propagates the intensity of social networking and influence the development of para .', 'The paper uses narrative to comprehend the co-evolution and correlation of para and adda as an unwavering tradition among the Bengali community in Kolkata .', 'Youth culture and identity in northern thailand : Fitting in and sticking out .', 'Youth Culture and Identity in Northern Thailand examines how young people in urban Chiang Mai construct an identity at the intersection of global capitalism , state ideology , and local culture .', 'Drawing on over 15 year of ethnographic research , the book explores the impact of rapid urbanisation and modernisation on contemporary Thai youth , focusing on conspicuous youth subculture , drug use ( especially methamphetamine use ) , and violent youth gang .', 'Anjalee Cohen shows how young Thai people construct a specific youth identity through consumerism and symbolic boundary – in particular through enduring rural/urban distinction .', 'The suggestion is that the formation of subculture and “ deviant ” youth practice , such as drug use and violence , are not necessarily form of resistance against the dominant culture , nor a pathological response to dramatic social change , as typically understood in academic and public discourse .', 'Rather , Cohen argues that such practice are attempt to “ fit in and stick out ” in an anonymous urban environment .', 'This volume is relevant to scholar in Thai Studies , Southeast Asian Studies , Anthropology , Sociology , Urban Studies , and Development Studies , particularly those with an interest in youth , drug , and gang .', 'Of pirate driver and honking horn mobility , authority , and urban planning in late-colonial accra .', 'This article attempts to bridge two literatures—the African history of urban life and the colonial history of urban planning—in order to better understand the politics of African mobility .', 'In doing so , it situates colonial history of urban planning and emerging African culture of auto-mobility within a broader critique of colonial technology and infrastructure .', 'This article argues that the reality of indirect rule—the autonomy of African urban resident and the weakness of colonial authority and infrastruc-ture—raised new question and problem for colonial official who were tasked with turning ideology into policy and practice .', 'In particular , mobility politics allow us to trace the way that “ average ” people negotiated colonial politics within and outside of the formal , elite structure of elected Town Councils , Legislative Assembles , or chieftaincy politics .', 'Within the colonial bureaucracy and the Town Council , African elites negotiated their own prestige and status alongside the interest and demand of the city ’ s lower-and middle-class population .']

['Factor affecting compliance with residential standard in the city of Old Salt , Jordan .', 'The aim of this paper is to examine the factor which impact on the extent to which urban housing complies with residential standard in the city of Old Salt based in Jordan .', 'The research found that the level of compliance with residential standard is quite low and can vary from one standard to another and from one house to another due to difference in the socio-economic characteristic among people .', 'The finding of multiple regression analysis reveal that there is a good level of public awareness of residential standard , but this does not result in complete compliance with residential standard .', 'Factor , such as household income per month , household size , finance facility , municipal administration culture , monitoring , enforcement and the uncertainty of residential standard have a significant impact on the extent of compliance with planning standard .', 'Suggestion for improved urban planning practice which address these issue are summarised in the paper and include reassessed current residential standard through comprehensive legal framework , linking residential standard with urban design approach , changing planning practice , developing information system to produce effective monitoring system of construction process and enforcement mechanism , the development of local staff including planner , designer and environmental engineer , supported partnership between private and public sector , and the use of participatory planning and citizen involvement .', 'Hong Kong architecture 1945-2015 : From colonial to global .', 'This book focuses on the transformation from colonial to global - the formation , mechanism , event , work and people related to urban architecture .', 'The book reveals hardships the city encountered in the 1950s and the glamour enjoyed in the 1980s .', 'It depicts the public and private development , and especially the public housing which has sheltered million of resident .', 'The author identifies the architect practising in the formative year and the representative of a rising generation after the 1980s .', 'Suffering from land shortage and a dense environment , the urban development of Hong Kong has in the past 70 year met the changing demand of fluctuating economic activity and a rising population .', 'Architecture on the island has been shaped by social demand , the economy and technology .', 'The building have been forged by the government , client , planner , architect , many contractor and end-users .', 'The built environment nurtures our life and is visual evidence of the way the city has developed .', 'Hong Kong is a key to East Asia in the Pacific Era .', 'The book is a must-read for a thorough understanding the contemporary history and architecture of this oriental pearl .', 'Endorsement : `` Hong Kong sets an extreme example of hyper-density living .', 'MTR ’ s Kowloon Station project offered my firm the unique opportunity to contribute to a new type of fully integrated three dimensional transport mega-structure , conceived as a well-connected place for people to live , work and play .', "Through Charlie Xue ’ s book , one can see how a compact city work and high density integrated development indicates a sustainable path for modern city making . ''", "Sir Terry Farrell , CBE , Principal , Farrells `` Well researched and refreshingly well structured , Charlie Xue ’ s latest book comprehensively shows how Hong Kong ’ s post-war urban architecture both track and symbolizes the former British colony ’ s rise to success - a must read for architecture and culture buff alike . ''", 'Peter G. Rowe , Raymond Garbe Professor of Architecture and Urban Design , Harvard University Distinguished Service Professor .', '`` An essential addition to the growing literature on Chinese architecture , the title of the book belies the full scope of Xue ’ s extensive history .', 'Covering Hong Kong ’ s postwar transition from defeated colony to Pacific Age power house , Xue expertly traces the evolution of the city ’ s ambitious and innovative program of integrated high density urban design and infrastructure , as well as changing architectural fashion .', "In a time when many Western government have all but abandoned public housing program , Xue ’ s book is a timely reminder of what can be achieved . ''", 'Professor Chris Abel , author of Architecture and Identity , Architecture , technology and process and The Extended Self .', 'Enablers and Barrier of Lean Implementation in Construction Projects .', 'Lean aim to maximize customer satisfaction while minimizing waste .', 'However , Lean philosophy has not been well understood yet in the construction industry for the fact that the complexity and dynamic nature of construction project bring up uncertainty that may be hardly handled by construction practitioner .', 'Moreover , project-based nature of construction business makes Lean implementation even more challenging for construction people .', 'Even though Lean effort in construction have recently increased , there are problem with the implementation processes .', 'It is undeniable that successful Lean implementation strongly affects project performance .', 'Therefore , it is essential to reveal enablers and barrier in Lean implementation so that the construction industry practitioner might conduct project more effectively and satisfy project requirement ( i.e .', 'schedule , budget , safety ) .', 'This study aims to provide a set of core enablers and barrier of Lean implementation in construction project and guide construction professional to better satisfy project requirement .', 'Within this context , the study proposes seven major enabler and barrier group , namely the financial , managerial , technical , workforce , culture , government , and communication and twenty-seven component for each group .', 'Moreover , a survey was designed and administered to Lean practitioner to rank the enablers and barrier based on importance level .', 'Clear understanding of technical requirement in Lean practice was ranked as the most important enabler of Lean implementation whereas lack of top management support was ranked as the most important barrier in the Lean implementation .', 'However , the average ranking were not found to be diverging indicating that selected component of enabler and barrier group are properly chosen .', 'The study is expected to lead Lean practitioner with creating value to customer while preventing them from experiencing waste .', "A high-rise vernacular in Singapore 's housing development board housing .", 'Vernacular architecture is commonly believed to be a quaint representation of the history and tradition of a culture , built by average people using traditional technology over a long period of time but in Singapore there are several indication that the Modernist high rise housing and new town have become a new vernacular .', 'The factor that support this point of view are : 1 ) the ubiquity of the high rise and new town way of life ; 2 ) a shared value system and culture within the new town that is shaped by and reflected in the architecture and planning of the new town ; 3 ) the importance of relationship between space in the new town ; 4 ) the ability of the architecture and planning of new town to adapt to change within Singaporean society ; 5 ) the acceptance , legitimacy , and identification of the high-rise way of life by Singaporeans .', 'A vernacular in Singapore based upon high-rise housing and new town profoundly impacts the understanding of vernacular architecture , Modernist planning , and the industrialization of former Third World country in response to the globalism .', 'Urban cohesion vis-à-vis organic spatialization of “ Third place ” in Saudi Arabia : The need for an alternative planning praxis .', 'Many medium-sized middle-eastern city like Khobar in Saudi Arabia have become a popular destination for predominantly low-to semi-skilled expatriate worker from several South and South East Asian country .', 'The social spatialization of these working class people has been manifested in compartmentalized public space as specific ethnic oriented “ third place ” , such as Filipino market , Bangladeshi bazaar , and Pakistani neighborhood .', 'Yet , there is no research scholarship available on the nature and type of such third place and their importance and influence on plan making process in the middle-eastern context .', 'Certain ( re- ) defining theme , notably expressing and celebrating everyday culture , feeling of home being away from home , sense of place , and center place for socialization and integration emerge to brand these place as we explored empirical evidence with grounded theory centered socio-cultural lens .', 'Additionally , exploring spatio-temporal permeability of these third place using Space Syntax accessibility model helped us to draw critical insight about how such lesson and practice can challenge the contemporary city planning and design practice .', 'Critical planning intervention like collaborative governance of third place as proposed here can be adopted in making city like Khobar cohesive .']
